title: Quality Improvement (QI) and Health Equity Integration Competency Enhancement Program for Medical Professionals

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Experiential project-based learning environment integrating QI (Quality Improvement) methodologies and health equity principles for practicing physicians

learning_goals: Identify health equity issues within healthcare systems and develop improvement plans using QI frameworks.

Following a competency-based education model, learners collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of 3–5 members to complete one real QI (Quality Improvement) project within a week, submit a project report, and meet predefined standards: team collaboration score ≥80%, project completeness ≥85%.

Learners statistically analyze treatment intervention effects using t-tests or ANOVA on a provided medical dataset (p-value < 0.05) and present results with at least two quantitative metrics: patient recovery period reduction (%) or readmission rate (%).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
